intro: Iguanura chaiana, commonly known as the yellow-eyed pisonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered yellow flowers that are often mistaken for eyes due to their appearance. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a leathery texture. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, hairy seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
